item.description:
Leader: Adam Skinner

I know it's short notice, but I'm planning on heading out along the ridge-line on the south side of 66 (whereas the ridge to the north is Mt. Higby). This is a fairly easy hike, skirting trap rock ridges and eventually (perhaps an hour in) leading to the top of a now defunct ski mountain: Powder Ridge.

From the top of this mountain, it's a comparatively short distance to the apple picking area at Lyman Orchards. If there's interest in picking up some apples, I wouldn't be too averse to that.

How Long:

I'm not quite certain how long this hike will take, but it should be around 3 hours. Start time is 11am, so plan on being out until around 2 or 3.

Directions:

From I-91S
* take exit 17 to E Main St and turn left. Keep on this road.
* Right before merging on to Rt 66, there will be a right turn that leads down to Black Pond (Black Pond Rd). We'll meet here, as this is the trailhead.

Map it with Google!

group.name: The Hartford Area Hikingâ„¢ Meetup Group

item.name: Black Pond to Powder Ridge (and maybe to Lyman Orchards)
